text:
Richard Shotwell Actress Charlotte Rae tells 'The Facts of My Life' in memoir 
FILE - In this Sept. 15, 2014, file photo, Charlotte Rae arrives at the 2014 PALEYFEST Fall TV Previews - "The Facts Of Life" Reunion in Beverly Hills, Calif. Rae recounts in her new autobiography, her own life bore little resemblance to the sitcom-grade serenity of her "Facts of Life" character, Edna Garrett, instead marked by challenges that included son Andy’s autism and her husband's late-in-life disclosure that he was bisexual and wanted an open marriage. (Photo by Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP, FILE) Charles Sykes Actress Charlotte Rae tells 'The Facts of My Life' in memoir 
FILE - In this April 10, 2011, file photo, Cloris Leachman, from left, Mindy Cohn, Kim Fields, Charlotte Rae, Geri Jewell and Nancy McKeon from the cast of "Facts of Life" accept the Pop Culture Award during the 2011 TV Land Awards show in New York. Rae recounts in her new autobiography, her own life bore little resemblance to the sitcom-grade serenity of her "Facts of Life" character, Edna Garrett, instead marked by challenges that included son Andy’s autism and her husband's late-in-life disclosure that he was bisexual and wanted an open marriage. (AP Photo/Charles Sykes, File) Posted: Monday, October 26, 2015 7:27 am | Updated: 8:00 am, Mon Oct 26, 2015. Actress Charlotte Rae tells 'The Facts of My Life' in memoir Associated Press | 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — In "The Facts of Life," Charlotte Rae played the unflappable Mrs. Garrett, a girls' school housemother who smoothly guided her charges through crises and comedy. 
Rae says she implored the TV show's producers to let her character "lose her temper, yell at the kids. Let her be a human being."
